wikipedia_page.main: Major General Evelyn Edward Thomas Boscawen, 7th Viscount Falmouth,  (24 July 1847 – 1 October 1918) was a British peer and British Army officer.

response: The Churchills had two sons: Winston (1874–1965), the future prime minister, was born less than eight months after the marriage. According to his biographer William Manchester, Winston was most likely conceived before the marriage, rather than born prematurely. A recent biography has stated that he was born two months prematurely after Lady Randolph "had a fall". When asked about the circumstances of his birth, Winston Churchill replied: "Although present on the occasion, I have no clear recollection of the events leading up to it." Lady Randolph's sisters believed that the biological father of the second son, John (1880–1947) was Evelyn Boscawen, 7th Viscount Falmouth.Anne Sebba, American Jennie: The Remarkable Life of Lady Randolph Churchill", Norton, 2008 although most discredited that due to the boys' striking likeness to their father and each other.
* 1 October  – Evelyn Boscawen, 7th Viscount Falmouth, artistocrat and army officer (born 1847)
** Evelyn Boscawen, 7th Viscount Falmouth, artistocrat and army officer (died 1918)

In 1937, he married the actress Pamela Carme (real name Kathleen Pamela Mary Corona Boscawen; 1902–1995), who was the daughter of the Evelyn Boscawen, 7th Viscount Falmouth. She retired from acting to be her husband's business partner.

link_mentions.page: Evelyn Edward Thomas Boscawen, 7th Viscount Falmouth

response: * Evelyn Boscawen, 7th Viscount Falmouth (1847–1918), British army officer

Clarissimus was a chestnut horse bred in the United Kingdom by his owner Evelyn Boscawen, 7th Viscount Falmouth. He was foaled on 15 January 1913. The colt was sent into training with William Waugh at the Kingsclere stable in Berkshire.

link_mentions.page: Stapleton baronets of the Leeward Islands (1679)
response: The barony passed to the granddaughter (Mary) Frances Elizabeth of the 6th baronet; she married Evelyn Boscawen, 6th Viscount Falmouth, and was mother of Evelyn Boscawen, 7th Viscount Falmouth, 14th Baron le Despencer (see Baron le Despencer for further history of this title). Her father the Hon. Thomas Stapleton (1792–1829), son of the 6th baronet, had married Maria Wynne Bankes, daughter of Henry Bankes, of Kingston House, Dorset.
